intro: Eriope velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf eriope, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in clusters. Eriope velutina is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
